statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Jackson's 22 helps Tech end seven-game streak
article.linkText: Knight and Day: Red Raiders finally beat Texas
article.story:
LUBBOCK, Texas (AP) -- Texas Tech coach Bob Knight loves a good rebound -- and not just the kind that comes off a backboard.
Texas Mis-step
Bob Knight's worst record vs. one school. Min.5 games
  W-L Win Pct.
Texas 2-7 .222
Princeton 2-5 .286
Boston College 2-4 .333
Syracuse 3-6 .333
He got a much-needed one from his team Tuesday night when the Red Raiders beat Texas 69-65 in their first conference win over the Longhorns since Knight arrived in 2001. Tech lost 85-56 at then-No. 8 Oklahoma State on Saturday. "We came from a very poor performance against an extremely great team on Saturday to play very well against a good team (tonight)," Knight said. "I have to like that about our team." Knight raised a clenched fist in response to cheers from remaining fans as he left the court as the arena cleared out. Jarrius Jackson scored 22 points in Tuesday's victory. He hit his fourth 3-pointer with 1:10 remaining in the game to give Tech a 65-59 lead but Daniel Gibson answered with one for Texas to give the Longhorns a chance with less than a minute remaining. Down 65-62, Texas tried to press Tech guard Ronald Ross as he dribbled up the floor. But all alone under the basket stood Darryl Dora, who dunked the ball to put Tech up 67-62 with 48 seconds remaining. "We were supposed to have somebody back," Texas coach Rick Barnes said. "Then again, those plays you can blame on me, I didn't get my message across so there's nobody to blame but me on that one." The only time Tech (17-7, 9-4 Big 12) has beaten Texas since Knight's arrival was in March 2003 at the Big 12 tournament. Last year Texas won at Tech after a 3-pointer by Brandon Mouton with no time remaining sent the game into overtime and the 16th-ranked Longhorns beat No. 13 Texas Tech 62-61 to snap the Red Raiders' 12-game winning streak. "They've been killing us all these years, or it was really close," Ross said. "We finally put one together and brought one home." The win Tuesday night put Tech in a tie for third place in the conference with Oklahoma, which plays at Tech on March 5. It was also the first loss in Lubbock for Barnes, who is in his seventh year coaching Texas (18-8, 7-6). It ended a three-game win streak for the Longhorns. Tech had four players in double figures. Ross scored 16 points, Dora had 13 and Martin Zeno added 10 for the Red Raiders. Tech trailed most of the way but went ahead 38-37 for the first time in the game after a 6-0 run with 16:12 remaining. There were three ties and 12 lead changes after that. Daniel Gibson scored 22 points, while Brad Buckman added 16 and 13 rebounds. It was the fifth game in six that Buckman got a double-double. Knight had nothing but praise for Gibson. "Gibson is as quick with the ball as anybody I've ever seen," he said. "A kid like that always creates problems because he changes direction so fast." Texas came into the game averaging 14 turnovers per outing. Against Tech, they had 17. "Turnovers always hurt you," Barnes said. "It's the unforced ones we allowed that hurt us. "You go back through the whole game, you can pick out a play here or a play there. The fact of the matter is we were in position and we didn't close it out." The last time the teams played when neither was ranked in The Associated Press Top 25 poll was in January 2002. Both teams had droughts in the first half. Texas' came after Daniel Gibson's 3-pointer that put the Longhorns up 28-17. Texas then had eight possessions with no points. Tech's came earlier, allowing Texas to score 10 unanswered points. Ross ended the half on a 3-pointer at the buzzer to cut Texas' lead to 33-30.
